keyFactors.title: Elite Recent 3PT Shooting
keyFactors.description: Maxey shooting 51.3% from three over last 9 games (37-72 FG). Red-hot stretch with consistent volume (8.0 attempts per game).

keyFactors.title: Embiid OUT - Primary Scoring Option
keyFactors.description: Joel Embiid sidelined with knee management. Maxey becomes undisputed first option, historically averaging +3.2 FGA and +1.8 3PA when Embiid sits.

keyFactors.title: Knicks' Perimeter Defense Weakness
keyFactors.description: Knicks ranked 23rd in opponent 3PT% (37.8%). Consistently allow high-volume three-point shooting. Missing Anunoby (ankle) - their best perimeter defender.

keyFactors.title: Pace and Volume Advantage
keyFactors.description: Game total 221.5 points. 76ers pace increases significantly without Embiid (transition opportunities). Maxey averaging 9.1 3PA in home games.

keyFactors.title: Historical Success vs Knicks
keyFactors.description: Maxey 4+ threes in 4 of last 6 meetings vs NYK. Averages 4.8 3PM vs Knicks (best vs any opponent). Familiarity with division rival.

riskFactors: Brunson backcourt battle could increase defensive attention
Knicks elite at limiting transition (may slow pace)

quarterBreakdown.description: Maxey came out aggressive, hitting 2-3 from deep early. 76ers jumped to 30-22 lead.
Hit ONE OVER line midway through 2nd quarter. Another three from top of key. 55-51 76ers at half.
Knicks rallied, Maxey went cold from three (0-2). Focused on playmaking (4 assists in quarter).
Clutch three from 27 feet with 4:12 left extended lead to 8. Dagger three with 1:08 remaining sealed victory.

gameResults.whenHit: Hit OVER (4 threes) with 6:47 remaining in 2nd quarter. Added 2 more in 4th quarter for insurance.
gameResults.gamePace: 217 total points (under 221.5 total). Slightly slower pace than projected, but still 106 possessions.
gameResults.defenseAdjustment: Knicks switched defensive assignments in 3rd quarter (Bridges on Maxey). Limited effectiveness but Maxey adjusted by facilitating.

whatWentRight.title: Early Aggression (PRIMARY FACTOR)
whatWentRight.description: Hit OVER by halftime (4 threes in first half). Took 7 three-point attempts in first 24 minutes. Secured bet before Knicks could adjust defensively.

whatWentRight.title: Clean Looks from Elite Spacing
whatWentRight.description: 76ers ran horns sets with Maxey as ball-handler. Created open threes via screen actions. 6 of 11 attempts classified as 'open' or 'wide open' (NBA tracking).

whatWentRight.title: Hot Shooting Continued
whatWentRight.description: 54.5% from three extended red-hot streak to 10 games. When a shooter is in rhythm, variance works in your favor. Maxey clearly in zone.

whatWentRight.title: High Volume Maintained
whatWentRight.description: 11 three-point attempts matched season average without Embiid. Volume is predictive edge - got the attempts we anticipated.

postGameAnalysis.wasNormalVariance: Positive but expected outcome. 6 threes with 11 attempts at 54.5% is above-average efficiency, but within normal variance for a hot shooter. More importantly, hit rate (77.8% over 9 games) suggested strong underlying edge. This was not luck - this was edge realization.

closingLineValue.verdict: Excellent CLV (+30 cents). Massive line movement toward OVER. Early bet captured significant value before sharp money moved line. Market validated our edge assessment.

keyTakeaways: Early bet placement crucial when injury news (Embiid OUT) still being priced in
Hot shooting streaks are REAL and exploitable (51.3% over 9 games = significant edge)
Usage rate increases without star teammate are highly predictive for volume props
Division rivals provide familiarity edge (historical performance vs opponent matters)
Hitting OVER by halftime provides emotional hedge against variance - bet was never in danger
This is textbook value betting: identified edge, got best available price, variance worked in our favor
verdict: Perfect execution. Process and results aligned. Model correctly identified mispriced line.
